sentences.sContent: His predecessor was accorded an equally tumultuous welcome.
sentences.sCn: 他的前任受到了同样热烈的欢迎。

sentences.sContent: On his return home, the government accorded him the rank of Colonel.
sentences.sCn: 在他回国时，该国政府授予他上校军衔。

trans.tranCn: 相符的；一致的；相应的；和谐的；调和的
给予( accord的现在分词 )；使和谐一致；使符合；使适合
trans.tranOther: If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act toward you or treat you in that way
